Step Functions#

This section covers the step functions used in AutoClean for EEG data processing.

IO Functions#

Functions for importing and saving EEG data.

Input/Output functions for EEG data.

This module provides a unified plugin-based architecture for loading and processing EEG data. Each plugin handles both the data import and montage configuration as a single unit, making it easier to extend functionality without modifying core code.

autoclean.step_functions.io.import_eeg(autoclean_dict: dict, preload: bool = True) → Raw | Epochs[source]#

Import EEG data using the appropriate plugin.

This function replaces the original import_eeg function but uses a unified plugin-based architecture.

Args:

autoclean_dict: Configuration dictionary preload: Whether to load data into memory

Returns:

mne.io.Raw or mne.Epochs: Imported and configured EEG data

Raises:

FileNotFoundError: If input file doesn’t exist ValueError: If no suitable plugin is found RuntimeError: If loading or validation fails

autoclean.step_functions.io.save_raw_to_set(raw: Raw, autoclean_dict: Dict[str, Any], stage: str = 'post_import', output_path: Path | None = None, flagged: bool = False) → Path[source]#

Save raw EEG data to file.

This function saves raw EEG data at various processing stages.

Args:

raw: Raw EEG data to save autoclean_dict: Configuration dictionary stage: Processing stage identifier (e.g., “post_import”) output_path: Optional custom output path. If None, uses config flagged: Whether to save to flagged directory

Returns:

Path: Path to the saved file (stage path)

Raises:

ValueError: If stage is not configured RuntimeError: If saving fails

autoclean.step_functions.io.save_epochs_to_set(epochs: Epochs, autoclean_dict: Dict[str, Any], stage: str = 'post_clean_epochs', output_path: Path | None = None, flagged: bool = False) → Path[source]#

Save epoched EEG data to file.

This function saves epoched EEG data, typically after processing.

Args:

epochs: Epoched EEG data to save autoclean_dict: Configuration dictionary stage: Processing stage identifier (default: “post_clean_epochs”) output_path: Optional custom output path. If None, uses config flagged: Whether to save to flagged directory

Returns:

Path: Path to the saved file (stage path)

Raises:

ValueError: If stage is not configured RuntimeError: If saving fails

autoclean.step_functions.io.register_plugin(plugin_class: Type[BaseEEGPlugin]) → None[source]#

Register a new EEG plugin.

Args:

plugin_class: Plugin class to register (must inherit from BaseEEGPlugin)

Raises:

TypeError: If plugin_class is not a subclass of BaseEEGPlugin

class autoclean.step_functions.io.BaseEEGPlugin[source]#

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for unified EEG data plugins.

Each plugin handles both importing data and configuring the montage for a specific combination of file format and EEG system.

abstract classmethod supports_format_montage(format_id: str, montage_name: str) → bool[source]#

Check if this plugin supports the given format and montage combination.

Args:

format_id: Format identifier montage_name: Name of the EEG montage/system

Returns:

bool: True if this plugin can handle the combination, False otherwise

abstract import_and_configure(file_path: Path, autoclean_dict: dict, preload: bool = True) → Raw | Epochs[source]#

Import data and configure montage in a single step.

Args:

file_path: Path to the EEG data file autoclean_dict: Configuration dictionary preload: Whether to load data into memory

Returns:

mne.io.Raw or mne.Epochs: Processed EEG data

Raises:

RuntimeError: If processing fails

process_events(raw: Raw, autoclean_dict: dict) → Tuple[ndarray | None, Dict | None, DataFrame | None][source]#

Process events and annotations in the EEG data.

Args:

raw: Raw EEG data autoclean_dict: Configuration dictionary

Returns:

tuple: (events, event_id, events_df) - processed events information

get_metadata() → Dict[str, Any][source]#

Get additional metadata about this plugin.

Returns:

dict: Additional metadata to include in the import record

autoclean.step_functions.io.register_format(extension: str, format_id: str) → None[source]#

Register a new file format.

Args:

extension: File extension without dot (e.g., ‘xyz’) format_id: Unique identifier for the format (e.g., ‘XYZ_FORMAT’)

class autoclean.step_functions.io.BaseEventProcessor[source]#

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for event processing plugins.

Each plugin handles task-specific event processing logic for a particular experimental paradigm or data format.

abstract classmethod supports_task(task_name: str) → bool[source]#

Check if this processor supports the given task.

Args:

task_name: Name of the task

Returns:

bool: True if this processor can handle the task, False otherwise

abstract process_events(raw: Raw, events: ndarray | None, events_df: DataFrame | None, autoclean_dict: dict) → Raw[source]#

Process events for a specific task.

Args:

raw: Raw EEG data events: Event array from MNE events_df: DataFrame containing event information autoclean_dict: Configuration dictionary

Returns:

mne.io.Raw: Raw data with processed events/annotations

autoclean.step_functions.io.register_event_processor(processor_class: Type[BaseEventProcessor]) → None[source]#

Register a new event processor plugin.

Args:

processor_class: Event processor class to register (must inherit from BaseEventProcessor)

Raises:

TypeError: If processor_class is not a subclass of BaseEventProcessor

autoclean.step_functions.io.get_event_processor_for_task(task_name: str) → BaseEventProcessor | None[source]#

Get appropriate event processor for the given task.

Args:

task_name: Name of the task

Returns:

BaseEventProcessor or None: An instance of the appropriate processor class, or None if not found

Continuous Processing Functions#

Functions for processing continuous EEG data.

Continuous preprocessing steps.

autoclean.step_functions.continuous.step_pre_pipeline_processing(raw: Raw, autoclean_dict: Dict[str, Any]) → Raw[source]#
autoclean.step_functions.continuous.step_create_bids_path(raw: Raw, autoclean_dict: Dict[str, Any]) → Tuple[Raw, Dict[str, Any]][source]#

Create BIDS-compliant paths.

autoclean.step_functions.continuous.step_clean_bad_channels(raw: Raw, autoclean_dict: Dict[str, Any]) → Raw[source]#

Clean bad channels.

autoclean.step_functions.continuous.step_run_pylossless(autoclean_dict: Dict[str, Any]) → Tuple[Any, Raw][source]#

Run PyLossless pipeline.

autoclean.step_functions.continuous.step_run_ll_rejection_policy(pipeline: Any, autoclean_dict: Dict[str, Any]) → Tuple[Any, Raw][source]#

Apply PyLossless rejection policy.

autoclean.step_functions.continuous.step_detect_dense_oscillatory_artifacts(raw, window_size_ms=100, channel_threshold_uv=50, min_channels=75, padding_ms=500)[source]#

Detect smaller, dense oscillatory multichannel artifacts while excluding large single deflections.

autoclean.step_functions.continuous.step_reject_bad_segments(raw: Raw, bad_label: str | None = None) → Raw[source]#

Remove all time spans annotated with a specific label (e.g., ‘BAD_LL’) or all segments starting with ‘BAD’ and concatenate the remaining segments.

Reporting Functions#

Functions for generating reports and visualizations.

Visualization and reporting functions.

DEPRECATED: This module is deprecated. Please use the reporting mixins instead.

The functionality from this module has been moved to: - autoclean.mixins.reporting.visualization.VisualizationMixin - autoclean.mixins.reporting.ica.ICAReportingMixin - autoclean.mixins.reporting.reports.ReportGenerationMixin

The reporting mixins provide the same functionality with improved integration with the Task class and better configuration handling.

This module provides functions for generating visualizations and reports from EEG processing results. It includes: - Run summary reports - Data quality visualizations - Artifact detection plots - Processing stage comparisons

The functions generate clear, publication-ready figures and detailed HTML reports documenting the processing pipeline results.

autoclean.step_functions.reports.step_plot_raw_vs_cleaned_overlay(raw_original: Raw, raw_cleaned: Raw, pipeline: Any, autoclean_dict: Dict[str, Any], suffix: str = '') → None[source]#

Plot raw data channels over the full duration, overlaying the original and cleaned data. Original data is plotted in red, cleaned data in black.

autoclean.step_functions.reports.step_plot_ica_full(pipeline: Any, autoclean_dict: Dict[str, Any]) → None[source]#

Plot ICA components.

autoclean.step_functions.reports.step_generate_ica_reports(pipeline: Any, cleaned_raw: Raw, autoclean_dict: Dict[str, Any], duration: int = 60) → None[source]#

Generates two reports: 1. All ICA components. 2. Only the rejected ICA components.

autoclean.step_functions.reports.plot_bad_channels_with_topography(raw_original, raw_cleaned, pipeline, autoclean_dict, zoom_duration=30, zoom_start=0)[source]#

Plot bad channels with a topographical map and time series overlays for both full duration and a zoomed-in window.

autoclean.step_functions.reports.create_run_report(run_id: str, autoclean_dict: dict | None = None) → None[source]#

Creates a scientific report in PDF format using ReportLab based on the run metadata.

Args:

run_id (str): The run ID to generate a report for Optional: autoclean_dict (dict): The autoclean dictionary

autoclean.step_functions.reports.update_task_processing_log(summary_dict: Dict[str, Any], flagged_reasons: list[str] = []) → None[source]#

Update the task-specific processing log CSV file with details about the current file.

Args:

summary_dict: The summary dictionary containing processing details flagged: Whether the task is flagged flagged_reasons: The reasons for flagging

autoclean.step_functions.reports.create_json_summary(run_id: str) → None[source]#
autoclean.step_functions.reports.generate_bad_channels_tsv(summary_dict: Dict[str, Any]) → None[source]#

General Step Functions#

Various processing steps for EEG data.

autoclean.step_functions.epochs.step_create_regular_epochs(cleaned_raw: Raw, pipeline: Any, autoclean_dict: Dict[str, Any]) → Epochs[source]#
autoclean.step_functions.epochs.step_create_eventid_epochs(cleaned_raw: Raw, pipeline: Any, autoclean_dict: Dict[str, Any]) → Epochs | None[source]#
autoclean.step_functions.epochs.step_prepare_epochs_for_ica(epochs: Epochs, pipeline: Any, autoclean_dict: Dict[str, Any]) → Epochs[source]#

Drops epochs that were marked bad based on a global outlier detection. This implementation for the preliminary epoch rejection was based on the Python implementation of the FASTER algorithm from Marijn van Vliet https://gist.github.com/wmvanvliet/d883c3fe1402c7ced6fc Parameters ———- epochs

Returns:
Epochs instance
autoclean.step_functions.epochs.step_gfp_clean_epochs(epochs: Epochs, pipeline: Any, autoclean_dict: Dict[str, Any], gfp_threshold: float = 3.0, number_of_epochs: int | None = None, random_seed: int | None = None) → Epochs[source]#

Clean an MNE Epochs object by removing outlier epochs based on GFP. Only calculates GFP on scalp electrodes (excluding those defined in channel_region_map).

Args:

epochs (mne.Epochs): The input epoched EEG data. gfp_threshold (float, optional): Z-score threshold for GFP-based outlier detection.

Epochs with GFP z-scores above this value are removed. Defaults to 3.0.

number_of_epochs (int, optional): If specified, randomly selects this number of epochs from the cleaned data.

If None, retains all cleaned epochs. Defaults to None.

random_seed (int, optional): Seed for random number generator to ensure reproducibility when selecting epochs.

Defaults to None.

Returns:

Tuple[mne.Epochs, Dict[str, any]]: A tuple containing the cleaned Epochs object and a dictionary of statistics.

autoclean.step_functions.epochs.step_apply_autoreject(epochs: Epochs, pipeline: Any, autoclean_dict: Dict[str, Any]) → Epochs[source]#

Apply AutoReject to clean epochs.

Args:

epochs (mne.Epochs): The input epoched EEG data pipeline: The pipeline object containing configuration and metadata autoclean_dict (dict): Dictionary containing pipeline configuration and metadata

Returns:

mne.Epochs: The cleaned epochs after AutoReject
